alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 6:00PM EST until January 12 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Dale County in southeastern Alabama... Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northeastern Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Western Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 645 PM EST/545 PM CST/. * At 600 PM EST/500 PM CST/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fort Gaines to Kinsey to near Slocomb, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Dothan, Blakely, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Edison, Webb, Columbia, Centerville, Malvern, Rehobeth, Grimes and Avon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST/800 PM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST/800 PM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
